newsitem.title: CHINA: Divorce up, marriage down in China.
newsitem.headline: Divorce up, marriage down in China.

text.p: China witnessed fewer marriages and more divorces than usual last year, the China Daily said on Friday, quoting the Ministry of Civil Affairs.

Official statistics showed that 9.34 million couples registered their marriages in 1996 while 1.13 million couples split up in the courts or official marriage registration agencies, the newspaper said.
Analysis of the statistics showed the national marriage rate slipped 0.05 per thousand from 1995 to 7.7 per thousand, it said.
The divorce rate climbed 0.1 per thousand to 1.9 per thousand across the nation, and soared to a record seven per thousand in the remote western region of Xinjiang, it said.
Analysts found the marriage rate falling all across China, except in the Himalayan region of Tibet and on the southern tropical island province of Hainan.
Hainan's marriage rate could have been boosted by an influx of young economic migrants, the newspaper quoted sociologists as saying.
The number of Chinese marrying foreigners in 1996 rose to 47,227, up 7.2 percent from 1995, the newspaper said. It did not give details.
